intro: Peucedanum kotschyi, commonly known as the Armenian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, often growing at high altitudes. Peucedanum kotschyi is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
